alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 3:50AM CST until December 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blowing and accumulating snow is expected. North winds gusting around 45 mph resulting in reduced visibility. * WHERE...In Kansas, Cheyenne and Sherman Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds combined with wet snow could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is potential for a heavy snow band to develop which would bring significantly higher snowfall totals and greater impacts. Strong north winds and falling snow may bring near blizzard to localized blizzard conditions, be prepared for difficult holiday travel. The heaviest snow looks to fall during the morning hours before waning through the afternoon. Blowing snow may still be possible if snow is able to accumulate.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
